title: Worked Solution
text: Thucydides is known as the father of scientific history. He wrote the History of the Peloponnesian War, which is considered one of the first works of scientific history. Thucydides used a critical and analytical approach to writing about historical events, emphasizing the importance of eyewitness accounts and primary sources. His work explored the causes and consequences of historical events, and the impact of political and social factors on human behavior. Thucydides' approach to writing history established a template for future historians and has been influential in shaping the modern understanding of the discipline.
